title: Is it true that in Pala, brilliant, they only give more priority to the A+ batch? - Quora

response.answer_text: firstly understand what is A+ or elite batch in brilliant pala… It is a group of students sorted after 1st month accordance with the performace with the performance in their weekly exams in brilliant pala…the selection doesn’t have any connection with marks that you scored in your plus two times…. And also each month they update the list and everytime you have a chance to enter elite batch ..once you are in elite you will never go out even if your performance is low after entering the batch… So now I comes to the benefits they will get…They will have elite exams on all tuesdays apart from the ordinary weekly exams conducted on all mondays…the speciality of elite exams is that you will get a chance to encounter with higher order questions… Another benefits is that they will get magazines of MTG for free and Books with questiom papers of previous year unit wise exams.They will also get extra question papers for practicing… Your strength and hardwork can make you a member of elite batch and I think its a good thing as you will get a chance to work even more nd more harder every time…. NB:Im not a member of elite batch till the end even I tried my level best..There you can see a very tight competition for A+ batch itself…

Not priority as such. They get to have an “elite exam” every week along with the regular weekly s. Also they get incentives like extra library books, resonance packages, qs papers etc. However ,the batch is rotatable. You can get in and be thrown out week after week. PS: there are many who are studying in govt. medical colleges without being in this batch. So focus on studying, leave the rest to our buddy above .
